cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with lossy source coding using LDGM codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The use of message-passing and decimation is a common technique in the study of random graphs and algorithms (cs.DS), and the paper specifically mentions the survey propagation algorithm, which is a well-known algorithm in this field. The paper also discusses the degree distributions of LDGM codes, which is a topic in coding theory (cs.CC). The use of Markov random fields is a common technique in machine learning and computer vision (cs.LG), and the paper uses this technique to define a family of Markov random fields over generalized codewords. Finally, the paper discusses the performance of the encoding method, which is a topic in artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
